UCB.name: AccuRev
UCB.description: AccuRev is a tool that provides version control for source code. The AccuRev plug-in automates populating an AccuRev workspace, creating a tag, and publishing source changes to the Changes tab of the buildlife.

notes: Installing this plugin will give you access to the AccuRev commands listed below. These steps will be available for use when designing a Job.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: AccuRev is a centralized version control system which uses a client/server model. It is built around a stream-based architecture in which streams form a hierarchical structure of code changes where parent streams pass on certain properties to child streams.

notes: Update to a newer version of a library for HTTP communication.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: AccuRev is a centralized version control system which uses a client/server model. It is built around a stream-based architecture in which streams form a hierarchical structure of code changes where parent streams pass on certain properties to child streams.

notes: Fixed an issue where communication with the UrbanCode Build server would fail if it was running with an IBM JDK/JRE.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: AccuRev is a centralized version control system which uses a client/server model. It is built around a stream-based architecture in which streams form a hierarchical structure of code changes where parent streams pass on certain properties to child streams.

notes: Updated to append the depot name to all change IDs. This prevents an issue where multiple depots can have the
same change ID causing issues to get picked up for depots that do not contain them.
Added RPX dependency and English translations.
Add support for using the transaction ID (revision) in the Changelog step.

UCB.name: AccuWork
UCB.description: The integration with AccuWork to report on issues and add comments to them. Available Steps

notes: Installing this plugin will give you access to the AccuWork commands listed below. These steps will be available for use when designing a Job.
Update to a newer version of a library for HTTP communication.
Changed the issue IDs that are uploaded to the Issues tab of a build life to contain their depot name so that they are always unique.
Do not process duplicate changes. Fix a memory leak that caused problems with large number of changes.
Fixed an issue where communication with the UrbanCode Build server would fail if it was running with an IBM JDK/JRE.
Added RPX dependency and English translations
Support property file encryption.

UCB.name: Ant
UCB.description: Apache Ant is a software tool that automates software processes during the building or deployment of an application. Ant uses an proprietary XML file to define build and deployment steps, which are referred to as targets in Ant. Ant is called to run the targets in the build.xml file.

notes: Loading the Ant plugin will give users access to the Ant Job steps for use when designing the deployment job.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: Apache Ant is a software tool to automate software processes during the build or deployment of an application. Ant uses an propitiatory XML file to define build and/or deployment steps(referred to as targets by ant) . The Ant executable is called to execute the targets in the build.xml

notes: Fix parsing of properties passed to Ant on the command line that have spaces in them.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: Apache Ant is a software tool to automate software processes during the build or deployment of an application. Ant uses an propitiatory XML file to define build and/or deployment steps(referred to as targets by ant) . The Ant executable is called to execute the targets in the build.xml

notes: Updated plugin to use plugin utility scripts.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: Apache Ant is a software tool to automate software processes during the build or deployment of an application. Ant uses an propitiatory XML file to define build and/or deployment steps(referred to as targets by ant) . The Ant executable is called to execute the targets in the build.xml

notes: Remove the 'JVM Properties' property because Ant ignores JAVA_OPTS
Added RPX dependency and English translations
Support property file encryption.
log4j and Jettison dependency updated.

Fix issue with artifact download links when preserving artifact file paths and using Artifactory Pro

UCB.name: CodeStation
UCB.description: The CodeStation plug-in provides steps to download artifacts from and upload artifacts to CodeStation. Available

notes: Added in a missing useCache property for the Download Artifacts step.
Version 5 requires uBuild 4.2.2 or later
Changed the CodeStation client to support dependencies.xml configurations. This version requires uBuild 4.3.1 or later
Added an option to fail an Upload Artifact step if either the directories do not exist or there are no artifacts in the directories.
Updated Http Library.
Updated CodeStation to properly handle empty 'includes' strings for an artifact set
Fixed an issue where communication with the UrbanCode Build server would fail if it was running with an IBM JDK/JRE.
Retry to upload files if they fail.
Use a newer version of the CodeStation Client that properly handles excludes.
Added RPX dependency and English translations
Support property file encryption.
Fix issue in Download Dependencies step when there is dependency conflict.
Add missing jar required by newer version of codestation client
Add new timeout property to Upload Artifacts step to allow configuring the http request timeout when uploading artifacts
Change the tag to "Repositories/Artifact/CodeStation".
Fix parsing value for the "Additional Hashes" field of the artifact upload steps
Update codestation client jar dependency to be able to properly use the charset value sent by UCB, where applicable.
Fix infinite loop during artifact upload if the includes pattern resolves to empty.
Add option to set agent's codestation cache dir.
Upgrade of jettison jar as part of security fix.

UCB.name: File Utils for IBM UrbanCode Build

notes: Updated the 'Update INI File' plugin step. Added option to allow users to add comments to sections. Added an option to give the user a choice between ';' and '#' for comments. UCB.name: Git for IBM UrbanCode Build
UCB.description: Git is a distributed revision control system. Git was initially designed and developed by Linus Torvalds for Linux kernel development. The Git plug-in automates cloning a Git repository, tagging source artifacts, and publishing source artifact changes to the Changes page of the build life.

notes: Installing this plugin will give you access to the steps listed below. These steps will be available for use when designing a Job.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: Git is a distributed revision control system with an emphasis on speed. Git was initially designed and developed by Linus Torvalds for Linux kernel development.

notes: Added support for triggering builds with GitHub or GitLab Webhooks

notes: Fixed upgrade for the new trigger script
Added RPX dependency and English translations
Improved handling of user credentials embedded in repository base url and repository configuration
Support property file encryption.
Fixed infinite build triggering issue with Github if creating a tag with the same name as an existing branch.
Fixed issue with repository trigger script not resolving parameterized repository base URL
Fix intermittent IOException stream closed errors
Fix incompatibility with UCB 6.1.2.x that was introduced in version 14 and prevented triggering builds in response to push events sent by GitHub.
Prefer using external web URL to construct the target URL in "Create GitHub Status" step when available.
Avoid NullPointerException if the HTTP client fails to execute and throws an exception before returning the response object.
Allow triggering builds for changes in arbitrary branches of a GitHub repository
Ignore BitBucket events related to deleting branches.
Properly handle charset when reading the response stream in changelog step.
Added provision to disable Build triggers on Draft Pull Request.
Added provision to use email id of authors instead of author name.
Fixed issue with triggering builds for GitLab Webhooks.
Added support for Git Tags

UCB.name: HP Quality Center
UCB.description: HP Quality Center (QC) is a set of web-based test management software offerings from the HP Software Division of Hewlett-Packard, many of which were acquired from Mercury Interactive Corporation. HP Quality Center offers software quality assurance, including requirements management, test management and business process testing for IT and application environments. In order for this plugin to work with HP ALM 11 and later, you must open the web UI of HP ALM from the agent machine, click on their ‘Add-ins Page’ link and install the ‘HP ALM Connectivity’ add-in.

notes: This version adds in a threshold value of test pass rate on the Run Test Set step

UCB.name: Shell for IBM UrbanCode Build
UCB.description: A shell provides an interface for users of an operating system that provides access to the services of a kernel. Operating system shells generally fall into one of two categories: command-line and graphical. Command-line shells provide a command-line interface (CLI) to the operating system, while graphical shells provide a graphical user interface (GUI). In either category, the primary purpose of the shell is to invoke or launch another program; however, shells frequently have additional capabilities such as viewing the contents of directories.

notes: Removed the duplicate directory offset property.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: A shell is a piece of software that provides an interface for users of an operating system which provides access to the services of a kernel.  Operating system shells generally fall into one of two categories: command-line and graphical. Command-line shells provide a command-line interface (CLI) to the operating system, while graphical shells provide a graphical user interface (GUI). In either category the primary purpose of the shell is to invoke or launch another program; however, shells frequently have additional capabilities such as viewing the contents of directories.

In either category the primary purpose of the shell is to invoke or launch another program; however, shells frequently have additional capabilities such as viewing the contents of directories.

Fix for getVersionStatus to handle versions with non-url-safe characters properly
Support encrypted input and output properties
Support property file encryption.
Make syncing of statuses between UCB/UCD fail-safe for UCB servers older than 6.1.2.2
Fix incompatibility issue with Groovy 2.4.10
Avoid terminating the step execution thread while error stream is being copied to output stream
Add the ability to specify properties in Deploy Component Version step
Use VersionCLIResource when creating version properties
Added 'Create Environment Snapshot' and 'Deploy With Snapshot' steps.
Fixed missing AuthenticationCredentials import in Upload All Artifact Sets.
Add new steps for creating and deleting auth tokens.
Add new step for invoking Buztool from a UCD agent directory.
Address a number of issues in "Create Component Version", "Add Component Version Status", and "Create Auth Token" steps.
Fixed the Approval reject scenario while "waiting for deployments" that need approval in UCD.
Added an option to fail an Upload Artifact step if either the directories do not exist or there are no artifacts in the directories.
Initial release. Installing this plugin will give you access to the Job as Code Step.
PLUGIN_FILES.description:
The Job As Config Plugin helps user to configure the job using a script file of YAML or JSON format.
    The Script file should be of UrbanCode Build pre-defined format

UCB.name: LogiGear TestArchitect for IBM UrbanCode Build
UCB.description: The LogiGear TestArchitect plug-in for IBM UrbanCode Deploy and Build provides steps to run tests using the TestArchitect command line interface.

UCB.name: Salesforce
UCB.description: The Salesforce plug-in for UrbanCode Build uses the Force.com Migration Tool to perform file-based deployment of metadata changes and Apex classes.

notes: Initial release of SalesForce plugin
Included support for RetrieveCode target.

UCB.name: UrbanCode Velocity
UCB.description: UrbanCode Velocity provides tools to help you visualize and understand your DevOps pipelines and processes. The UrbanCode Velocity plug-in uploads build data into the UrbanCode Velocity server.

notes: Initial release, providing the capability to upload build data to UrbanCode Velocity.
Add revision to build data that is sent to UrbanCode Velocity.
Fix for proper revision and requester name lookup.
Revision to upload metrics data that is sent to UrbanCode Velocity.
Installing this plugin will give you access to the SonarQube commands listed below. These steps will be available for use when designing a Job.
Fixed parse issue when a additional properties are defined for job step
Initial release. Installing this plugin will give you access to the steps listed below.
This version upgrade is a rebranding to HCL family of products.

PLUGIN_FILES.description: ERROR FILE DAMAGED

notes: Update to a newer version of a library for HTTP communication.
Initial release. Installing this plugin will give you access to the steps listed below.
Added a two new steps that allow uploading of artifact sets to an existing version
PLUGIN_FILES.description: Release management and automation to improve speed, correctness, and traceability of complex application deployments.

notes: Add a optional description to created component versions. Optionally add properties in the create version step.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: Release management and automation to improve speed, correctness, and traceability of complex application deployments.

notes: Update the 'Upload All Artifact Sets' to set component version description and properties.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: Release management and automation to improve speed, correctness, and traceability of complex application deployments.

notes: Update the 'Upload All Artifact Sets' transfer artifacts from server to server. This requires uBuild 4.3 or later.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: Release management and automation to improve speed, correctness, and traceability of complex application deployments.

notes: Fix a bug in the Create Component Version step when creating multiple new properties on the component. This requires uBuild 4.3 or later.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: Release management and automation to improve speed, correctness, and traceability of complex application deployments.

notes: Added a step for adding statuses to versions. Updated the Create Component Version step to allow adding statuses during creation.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: Release management and automation to improve speed, correctness, and traceability of complex application deployments.

notes: Added compatibility with uDeploy servers before 4.8.4 when using the Create Component Version and Add Component Version Status steps.
PLUGIN_FILES.description: Release management and automation to improve speed, correctness, and traceability of complex application deployments.

notes: Fix a bug in the Upload All Artifact Sets step where the step would fail if a component name contained a forward slash.

notes: Fixed a bug in Set Version Properties step for uDeploy 5.0 where multiple Set Version Properties steps would overwrite each other.
